DOCNAME: CASE OF STRELTSOV AND OTHER "NOVOCHERKASSK MILITARY PENSIONERS" CASES v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violations of Art. 6-1;Violations of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The CARDINAL applicants were born on the dates listed in GPE I and live in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicants , retired military officers , sued the military commissariats of GPE and GPE for recalculation of their pensions . CARDINAL group of the applicants sought adjustment of the pension to the minimum wage and claimed arrears for DATE in line with the increase in the latter . Another group of the applicants claimed recalculation of their pensions on account of the increase of the monetary compensation paid in respect of the food allowance . Several applicants raised both types of claims before the domestic courts .

CARDINAL . On the dates listed in ORG I the domestic courts found in the applicants ' favour . As regards the case no . CARDINAL by PERSON , the judgment of DATE was issued by the Justice of the Peace of the CARDINALth ORG . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE in favour of PERSON , as well as all the judgments in favour of the remaining DATE applicants , were issued by ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . The court ordered in respect of the first type of the claims that the pensions be adjusted to the minimum wage and that the arrears be paid to the applicants . As concerns the second type of the claims , the court held that the pensions should be increased in line with the increase of the DATE food allowance and awarded the applicants the respective lump sums in arrears . The awards were made against ORG of GPE , while the respective claims against the commissariat of GPE had been dismissed .
CARDINAL . NORP The representatives of ORG of GPE were present at the court room on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . In several cases the respondent authority introduced the grounds of appeal with ORG . However , on various dates in DATE the respondent authority revoked their applications . For example , in case of Mr Turutin ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) the grounds for appeal were revoked on DATE . As a result , none of the judgments was appealed against . They entered into force DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicants took various steps to obtain execution of the judgment . In particular , the Government submitted that in DATE Mr Sobolev , PERSON and DATE other applicants sent the writs of execution to the respondent authority . It follows from the incoming correspondence log of the Rostov ORG that the latter received the writs .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the military prosecutor 's office started an inquiry into lawfulness of proceedings concerning military pension arrears throughout GPE and detected several instances of fraud . In particular , they found out that the respondent commissariat on several occasions had made payments against forged writs of execution issued in the similar but unrelated proceedings . On various dates the enforcement proceedings in the cases at hand were suspended pending the region wide inquiry , because the prosecutor 's office had to establish authenticity of the writs of execution issued in the applicants ' cases . It appears that the investigation did not reveal any evidence of fraud in the present cases .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in DATE judge A. who had issued the judgments in question was dismissed by the decision of ORG of GPE . At some point several high officials of ORG of GPE had been charged with and convicted of embezzlement .

CARDINAL . As regards the group of CARDINAL applicants named in Part A of Annex I , the domestic awards in their favour were fully executed by the respondent authorities on the dates specified in the table . As concerns the remaining applicants whose names are listed in Part B of ORG I , CARDINAL judgment in their favour has remained unenforced .
CARDINAL . On various dates in DATE the respondent commissariat applied for the supervisory review of the judgments .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG 's observations , CARDINAL requests for review were lodged outside the DATE time - limit from the date of the judgment 's entry into force . In such cases , the respondent authority also applied for extension of the time - limit for application for supervisory review arguing that it had not received copies of the respective first instance judgments in time and had only been informed of the judgments in DATE , when the prosecutor 's inquiry had been opened . On various dates ORG allowed these applications . In particular , in case of PERSON ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) the ORG on DATE accepted the authority 's argument that they had been unaware of the judgment , having found , in particular , as follows :

“ There is no evidence in the case materials to the effect that a copy of the judgment of DATE ... had been sent to ORG of GPE . It follows from the above that the [ respondent commissariat ] had a real opportunity to avail itself of its right to apply for supervisory review within DATE . ”
CARDINAL . ORG made similar findings in respect of CARDINAL remaining cases .
CARDINAL . Enforcement of the unexecuted domestic judgments had been suspended pending the supervisory review .

CARDINAL . On various dates in DATE ORG allowed the applications for supervisory review of the judgments lodged by the military commissariat of GPE and remitted the matter for examination on the merits to the Presidium of the Rostov Regional Court .

CARDINAL . On the dates specified in GPE I the Presidium of the Rostov ORG quashed the judgments in the applicants ' favour and remitted the cases for a fresh consideration . In each case the ORG concluded that the first - instance court had erroneously applied the substantive law . They also found that ORG had lacked territorial jurisdiction to examine the cases . The arrears were awarded against ORG of GPE and thus the cases should have been examined by a court in LOC of GPE - on - Don where the respondent commissariat was located .
CARDINAL . NORP The cases were considered afresh by ORG of PERSON - on - Don .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , PERSON ( application no . ORG ) modified the scope of his claim in the new round of the proceedings concerning the adjustment of his pension to the increase of the minimum wage . On DATE ORG granted his action in full and ordered that he be paid MONEY ( RUB ) . The judgment was executed . The parties did not submit copies of the respective statement of claims and judicial decision .

CARDINAL . As regards the remaining applicants , the court either discontinued the proceedings or dismissed the applicants ' claims . The particulars of the respective proceedings are summarised in GPE I below .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE ( in force from DATE ) , judicial decisions that have become legally binding , with the exception of judicial decisions by the ORG of ORG of GPE , may be appealed against to a court exercising supervisory review , by parties to the case and by other persons whose rights or legal interests have been adversely affected by the judicial decisions concerned ( § CARDINAL ) . Judicial decisions may be appealed against to a court exercising supervisory review within DATE after they became legally binding ( § CARDINAL ) . By its ruling of CARDINAL DATE , ORG interpreted LAW as allowing the above - mentioned persons to apply for supervisory review only after having exhausted all available ordinary appeals
CARDINAL . For the summary of other applicable provisions of the domestic law , see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE .

CARDINAL . LAW provides that a civil claim is to be filed with the court with territorial jurisdiction over the defendant 's place of residence . A claim against the organisation is to be filed with the court having territorial jurisdiction over the organisation 's residence . According to LAW , where a claim is filed against several defendants having different places of residence , a claim is to be lodged with a court having territorial jurisdiction over one of the defendants , upon the claimant 's choice .

CARDINAL . Succession is regulated by Part CARDINAL of LAW . The succession includes the deceased 's property or pecuniary rights or claims but does not include rights or obligations intrinsically linked to the deceased 's person , such as alimony or a right to compensation for health damage ( Article CARDINAL ) . An heir should claim and accept succession , as well as obtain a succession certificate from a public notary ( Articles DATE , DATE ) . The right to receive the amounts of salary and payments qualifying as such , pension and other amounts of money provided to the deceased person as means of subsistence which had been payable but had not been received in his lifetime shall belong to the members of the deceased 's family who had been residing together with him and also his disabled dependants , irrespective of their having resided with the deceased or not ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . In accordance with section CARDINAL of LAW ( DATE ) , as in force at the material time , the amount of pension due to a pensioner but not received in his lifetime shall belong to the members of the deceased 's family if they were in charge of his or her funeral , and shall not be included in the succession .
